summary: Starting college at UMass Boston as an IT major; foundations and problem solving.
highlights: Established study workflow; first exposure to structured problem solving.

artifacts.title: Display Connector Catalog (VGA, DVI, HDMI, DP, Thunderbolt) — Group Project
artifacts.desc: Quick reference comparing purpose, ports, and trivia for common display connectors; collaborative class assignment.

artifacts.title: Devices Inventory — Group Project
artifacts.desc: Spreadsheet comparing devices by specs and purpose.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — Project 8 (Tasks 1–6)
artifacts.desc: Configured end devices, deployed & cabled a small LAN, validated paths with PDUs, and documented physical/logical views.

artifacts.title: VirtualBox on Fedora — VM Setup Demo
artifacts.desc: Short screen recording introducing Linux via Fedora in VirtualBox.

artifacts.title: My First Website — “Wlacien’s Favorite Hobby”
artifacts.desc: First HTML page for IT 110: headings, images, and paragraphs—no frameworks.

summary: Second semester at UMass Boston; intro to databases and networking.
highlights: Hands-on with ER modeling, MySQL, and basic subnetting; Cisco Packet Tracer labs.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — Basic IP Config & Ping Validation
artifacts.desc: Configured PC0, verified local pings, and confirmed cross-subnet ping fails as expected (no routing).

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — HTTP Request Simulation & PDU Layer Analysis
artifacts.desc: Simulation mode to browse to a web host; inspected Ethernet II → IPv4 → TCP → HTTP fields.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — DHCP Client with ipconfig
artifacts.desc: Switched to DHCP, received a lease, and reviewed details using ipconfig /all.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — ICMP Packet Capture (Internetwork Layer)
artifacts.desc: Capture/Forward to inspect outbound PDU (Ethernet → IP → ICMP) fields.

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — ARP Broadcast & Header Fields
artifacts.desc: Triggered ARP and inspected outbound PDU (Ethernet II + ARP) MAC/IP fields.

artifacts.title: Essay — AI in Gaming (ENGL 101)
artifacts.desc: Short essay on how AI enhances visuals, NPC behavior, and dynamic gameplay (Mar 25, 2023).

artifacts.title: Essay — AI in the Criminal Justice System (ENGL 101)
artifacts.desc: Surveys benefits (predictive policing, risk assessment) and concerns (bias, transparency, privacy).

artifacts.title: How to Build an Ethernet Patch Cable
artifacts.desc: Cut/strip cable, crimp RJ-45, and verify with a cable tester.

artifacts.title: SQL Coursework — KIMTAY Sales DB (DDL/DML + Queries)
artifacts.desc: Sample sales DB and practice queries (joins, subqueries, GROUP BY/HAVING, stored procedures).

artifacts.title: Packet Tracer — Home Network: DHCP Renew & Connectivity Check
artifacts.desc: Released/renewed DHCP and verified connectivity to the gateway.

artifacts.title: Networking a Stand-Alone Windows Machine
artifacts.desc: Checked MAC/IP with ipconfig, enabled folder sharing, and validated peer discovery.

artifacts.title: Wi-Fi Router Security Lab (Project 10)
artifacts.desc: Reviewed SSID, channels, WPA/WPA2, AES/TKIP, passphrase strength, guest isolation, and client filtering.

summary: Transferred to Florida International University (FIU): starting a B.S. in Cybersecurity.

artifacts.title: Java Labs Pack (Fall 2023)
artifacts.desc: All intro-level Java labs in one bundle.

artifacts.title: Informative Speech — Security Threats
artifacts.desc: Explains common attack vectors: eavesdropping, social engineering, phishing, shoulder surfing, and dumpster diving.

artifacts.title: Persuasive Speech — Cybersecurity Awareness (SPC 2608)
artifacts.desc: Advocates a 'human firewall' culture (Train • Analyze • Win) and device/browser hygiene.

summary: Second semester at FIU; getting more used to college life.
highlights: Started using Linux more often; publishing on GitHub.

artifacts.title: Essay — AI’s Role in Cybersecurity (ENC 1102)
artifacts.desc: Explores AI for detections/anomaly spotting and emerging offensive-AI risks.

artifacts.title: C Program — Functions, Loops, and Basic Arithmetic
artifacts.desc: Small arithmetic routines and loop variants orchestrated in main.

artifacts.title: C Program — Math, Random, and String Parsing
artifacts.desc: Uses math.h routines, rand(), and string parsing with a simple pyramid formatter.

artifacts.title: C Program — 2D Arrays, Swapping/Sorting, ASCII & Loops
artifacts.desc: Builds a 10×10 table, computes totals, sorts numbers, and prints ASCII sequences.

summary: Diving deeper into cybersecurity: operating systems, intermediate Java, and discrete math.
highlights: Dean’s List; deeper systems knowledge and problem solving. Using Kali Linux daily in VirtualBox.

artifacts.title: Java OOP — Library Mini-Project (Book + Tester)
artifacts.desc: Book model with availability and a static counter; borrow/return + late fee; driver + UML.

artifacts.title: Java OOP — Inheritance (Animal → Bird → Canary)
artifacts.desc: Multi-level inheritance with method overrides; driver + UML.

artifacts.title: Java OOP — Polymorphism & Abstraction (Vehicle/Car/Airplane)
artifacts.desc: Abstract Vehicle + Flyable interface; overridden behaviors via polymorphic calls; UML.

term: Spring 2025 — My hardest semester at college
summary: Applied networking, professional technical writing, and HCI.
courses: CGS 1920 — Intro to the Field of Computing
highlights: Dean’s List; began publishing more on GitHub and attending CTFs.

artifacts.title: Network Design — Subnetting, Routing & Firewall Segmentation
artifacts.desc: Multi-site network from 128.60.80.0/23: VLSM plan, /30 links, router interfaces, and server DMZ behind a firewall.

artifacts.title: Recommendation Report — Premium Membership Program (Noble 33)
artifacts.desc: Full report: methods, evaluation criteria, findings, and a tiered membership recommendation with pilot plan.

artifacts.title: Business Letter — Client Billing Remediation
artifacts.desc: Apology + remediation letter for a 13% overbilling incident; proposes service-based remediation.

artifacts.title: Internal Memo — Billing Error & Next Steps
artifacts.desc: Explains over-billing, outlines client engagement/ops support/feedback, and proposes next steps.

artifacts.title: Proposal — Fixing Leadership Engagement in PantherSec
artifacts.desc: Plan to investigate low leadership participation via interviews and best-practice research.

term: Summer 2025 — Preparations started for AWS Security Specialty
summary: Automation, information retrieval, and global policy; started certificate in Cyber Intel & Info Policy.
courses: ISS 3613 — Issues in Global Cybersecurity Policy
COP 4703 — Information Retrieval and Database Systems Management
highlights: Dean’s List 3× in a row; drift auto-remediation mini-project.

artifacts.title: Policy Paper — AI as a Double-Edged Sword in Cyber Defense
artifacts.desc: Analyzes how AI boosts detection/response yet enables offensive misuse; identifies U.S. policy gaps and recommends governance and oversight.

summary: Capstone, data comms, and cyber policy.
courses: CGS 3095 — Technology in the Global Arena
highlights: Capstone I underway; continuing Cyber Intel & Info Policy certificate.
